intro: Blechum linnaei var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered blechum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and compact inflorescence. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
